content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df)
    df.ym = @. (year(df.dt) * 100 + month(df.dt))
end
```
This function first extracts the year and month from the `dt` column using the `year` and `month` functions from the `Dates` module. Then it creates a new column `ym` by concatenating the two values together as an integer in format "yyyymm". The `@.` macro is used to broadcast the function over the rows of the `df` DataFrame.
